member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of memory allocation types.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Commit
member.summary: Allocates memory charges (from the overall size of memory and the paging files on disk) for the specified reserved memory pages. The function also guarantees that when the caller later initially accesses the memory, the contents will be zero. Actual physical pages are not allocated unless/until the virtual addresses are actually accessed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Reserve
member.summary: Reserves a range of the process's virtual address space without allocating any actual physical storage in memory or in the paging file on disk.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Decommit
member.summary: Decommits the specified region of committed pages. After the operation, the pages are in the reserved state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Release
member.summary: Releases the specified region of pages. After the operation, the pages are in the free state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Reset
member.summary: Indicates that data in the memory range specified by lpAddress and dwSize is no longer of interest. The pages should not be read from or written to the paging file. However, the memory block will be used again later, so it should not be decommitted. This value cannot be used with any other value.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.Physical
member.summary: Reserves an address range that can be used to map Address Windowing Extensions (AWE) pages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.TopDown
member.summary: Allocates memory at the highest possible address. This can be slower than regular allocations, especially when there are many allocations.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.WriteWatch
member.summary: Causes the system to track pages that are written to in the allocated region. If you specify this value, you must also specify .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemAllocTypes.LargePages
member.summary: Allocates memory using large page support.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.MemFreeType
member.summary: Provides enumerated free type values of memory allocation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemFreeType.Decommit
member.summary: Decommits the specified region of committed pages. After the operation, the pages are in the reserved state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemFreeType.Release
member.summary: Releases the specified region of pages. After the operation, the pages are in the free state.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated constants of memory protection.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageNoAccess
member.summary: Disables all access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to read from, write to, or execute the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageReadOnly
member.summary: Enables read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, an attempt to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageReadWrite
member.summary: Enables read-only or read/write access to the committed region of pages. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageWriteCopy
member.summary: Enables read-only or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as , and the change is written to the new page. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageExecute
member.summary: Enables execute access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageExecuteRead
member.summary: Enables execute or read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageExecuteReadWrite
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or read/write access to the committed region of pages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageExecuteWriteCopy
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as , and the change is written to the new page.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageGuard
member.summary: Pages in the region become guard pages. Any attempt to access a guard page causes the system to raise a STATUS_GUARD_PAGE_VIOLATION (0x80000001) exception and turn off the guard page status. Guard pages thus act as a one-time access alarm.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageNoCache
member.summary: Sets all pages to be non-cachable. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped with can result in an .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageWriteCombine
member.summary: Sets all pages to be write-combined.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageTargetsInvalid
member.summary: Sets all locations in the pages as invalid targets for CFG. Used along with any execute page protection like , , and . Any indirect call to locations in those pages will fail CFG checks and the process will be terminated. The default behavior for executable pages allocated is to be marked valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MemProtectFlags.PageTargetsNoUpdate
member.summary: Pages in the region will not have their CFG information updated while the protection changes for VirtualProtect. For example, if the pages in the region was allocated using , then the invalid information will be maintained while the page protection changes. This flag is only valid when the protection changes to an executable type like , , and . The default behavior for VirtualProtect protection change to executable is to mark all locations as valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated options for MIME functions.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.Default
member.summary: No flags specified. Use default behavior for the function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.UrlAsFileName
member.summary: Treat the specified pwzUrl as a file name.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.EnableMimeSniffing
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Use MIME-type detection even if FEATURE_MIME_SNIFFING is detected. Usually, this feature control key would disable MIME-type detection.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.IgnoreMimeTextPlain
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Perform MIME-type detection if "text/plain" is proposed, even if data sniffing is otherwise disabled. Plain text may be converted to text/html if HTML tags are detected.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.ServerMime
member.summary: Internet Explorer 8. Use the authoritative MIME type specified in pwzMimeProposed. Unless is specified, no data sniffing is performed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.RespectTextPlain
member.summary: Internet Explorer 9. Do not perform detection if "text/plain" is specified in pwzMimeProposed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.MimeFlags.ReturnUpdatedImgMimes
member.summary: Internet Explorer 9. Returns image/png and image/jpeg instead of image/x-png and image/pjpeg.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of menu items.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.ByCommand
member.summary: Indicates that the uPosition parameter gives the identifier of the menu item. The flag is the default if neither the nor flag is specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Enabled
member.summary: Enables the menu item so that it can be selected and restores it from its grayed state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.TextString
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item is a text string; the lpNewItem parameter is a pointer to the string.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Unchecked
member.summary: Does not place a check mark next to the item (the default). If your application supplies check-mark bitmaps (see the SetMenuItemBitmaps function), this flag displays a clear bitmap next to the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Grayed
member.summary: Disables the menu item and grays it so that it cannot be selected.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the menu item so that it cannot be selected, but this flag does not gray it.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Bitmap
member.summary: Uses a bitmap as the menu item. The lpNewItem parameter contains a handle to the bitmap.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Checked
member.summary: Places a check mark next to the item. If your application provides check-mark bitmaps (see the SetMenuItemBitmaps function), this flag displays a selected bitmap next to the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Popup
member.summary: Specifies that the menu item opens a drop-down menu or submenu. The uIDNewItem parameter specifies a handle to the drop-down menu or submenu. This flag is used to add a menu name to a menu bar or a menu item that opens a submenu to a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.MenuBarBreak
member.summary: Functions the same as the flag for a menu bar. For a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu, the new column is separated from the old column by a vertical line.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.MenuBreak
member.summary: Places the item on a new line (for menu bars) or in a new column (for a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu) without separating columns.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.OwnerDraw
member.summary: Specifies that the item is an owner-drawn item. Before the menu is displayed for the first time, the window that owns the menu receives a WM_MEASUREITEM message to retrieve the width and height of the menu item. The WM_DRAWITEM message is then sent to the window procedure of the owner window whenever the appearance of the menu item must be updated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.ByPosition
member.summary: Indicates that the uPosition parameter gives the zero-based relative position of the menu item.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Separator
member.summary: Draws a horizontal dividing line. This flag is used only in a drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu. The line cannot be grayed, disabled, or highlighted. The lpNewItem and uIDNewItem parameters are ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ModifyMenuFlags.Remove
member.summary: Remove uPosition parameters.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the process information class.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags.ProcessBasicInformation
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to a PEB structure that can be used to determine whether the specified process is being debugged, and a unique value used by the system to identify the specified process.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags.ProcessDebugPort
member.summary: Retrieves a DWORD_PTR value that is the port number of the debugger for the process. A nonzero value indicates that the process is being run under the control of a ring 3 debugger.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags.ProcessWow64Information
member.summary: Determines whether the process is running in the WOW64 environment (WOW64 is the x86 emulator that allows Win32-based applications to run on 64-bit Windows).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags.ProcessImageFileName
member.summary: Retrieves a value containing the name of the image file for the process.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ProcessInfoFlags.ProcessBreakOnTermination
member.summary: Retrieves a value indicating whether the process is considered critical.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the redraw window flags.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.Invalidate
F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.InternalPaint
member.summary: Causes a WM_PAINT message to be posted to the window regardless of whether any portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.Erase
F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.Validate
F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.NoInternalPaint
member.summary: Suppresses any pending internal WM_PAINT messages. This flag does not affect WM_PAINT messages resulting from a non- update area.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.NoErase
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.NoChildren
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.AllChildren
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.UpdateNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT, WM_ERASEBKGND, and WM_PAINT messages, if necessary, before the function returns.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.EraseNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT and WM_ERASEBKGND messages, if necessary, before the function returns. WM_PAINT messages are received at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.Frame
member.summary: Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a WM_NCPAINT message. The flag must also be specified; otherwise, has no effect. The WM_NCPAINT message is typically not sent during the execution of RedrawWindow unless either or is specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RedrawWindowFlags.NoFrame
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_NCPAINT messages. This flag must be used with and is typically used with . should be used with care, as it could cause parts of a window to be painted improperly.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of service errors.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.Ignore
member.summary: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.Normal
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.Severe
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceError.Critical
member.summary: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated attributes of memory allocation.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoSize
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoMove
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoZOrder
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoRedraw
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoActive
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.DrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.FrameChanged
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.ShowWindow
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.HideWindow
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoCopyBits
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoOwnerZOrder
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoReposition
member.summary: Same as the flag.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.NoSendChanging
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING (0x46) message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.DeferErase
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SetWindowPosFlags.AsyncWindowPos
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ShowScrollBarOption
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of scroll bar show statements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowScrollBarOption.Horizontal
member.summary: Shows or hides a window's standard horizontal scroll bars.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowScrollBarOption.Vertical
member.summary: Shows or hides a window's standard vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowScrollBarOption.Control
member.summary: Shows or hides a scroll bar control. The hwnd parameter must be the handle to the scroll bar control.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowScrollBarOption.Both
member.summary: Shows or hides a window's standard horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window's show statements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowNormal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowNa
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ShowWindowFlags.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights
member.summary:
Provides enumerated values of standard access rights.
Each type of securable object has a set of access rights that correspond to operations specific to that type of object. In addition to these object-specific access rights, there is a set of standard access rights that correspond to operations common to most types of securable objects.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete the object.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.ReadControl
member.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.WriteDac
member.summary: The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.WriteOwner
member.summary: The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.Synchronize
member.summary: The right to use the object for synchronization. This enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state. Some object types do not support this access right.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.All
member.summary: Combines , , , and access.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StandardAccessRights.Required
member.summary: Combines , , , and access.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated hook constants.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtMoveSize
member.summary: A window is about to be moved or sized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtMinMax
member.summary: A window is about to be minimized or maximized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtQs
member.summary: The system has retrieved a WM_QUEUESYNC message from the system message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtCreateWnd
member.summary: A window is about to be created. The system calls the hook procedure before sending the WM_CREATE or WM_NCCREATE message to the window. If the hook procedure returns a nonzero value, the system destroys the window; the CreateWindow function returns , but the WM_DESTROY message is not sent to the window. If the hook procedure returns zero, the window is created normally. At the time of the notification, the window has been created, but its final size and position may not have been determined and its parent window may not have been established. It is possible to send messages to the newly created window, although it has not yet received WM_NCCREATE or WM_CREATE messages. It is also possible to change the position in the z-order of the newly created window by modifying the hwndInsertAfter member of the CBT_CREATEWND structure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtDestroyWnd
member.summary: A window is about to be destroyed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtActivate
member.summary: The system is about to activate a window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtClickSkipped
member.summary: The system has removed a mouse message from the system message queue. Upon receiving this hook code, a CBT application must install a hook procedure in response to the mouse message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtKeySkipped
member.summary: The system has removed a keyboard message from the system message queue. Upon receiving this hook code, a CBT application must install a hook procedure in response to the keyboard message.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtSysCommand
member.summary: A system command is about to be carried out. This allows a CBT application to prevent task switching by means of hot keys.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.HCbtSetFocus
member.summary: A window is about to receive the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.MsgFDialogBox
member.summary: The input event occurred in a message box or dialog box.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.MsgFMenu
member.summary: The input event occurred in a menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhMsgFilter
member.summary: The and hooks enable you to monitor messages about to be processed by a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box, and to detect when a different window is about to be activated as a result of the user's pressing the ALT+TAB or ALT+ESC key combination. The hook can only monitor messages passed to a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box created by the application that installed the hook procedure. The hook monitors such messages for all applications.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhJournalRecord
member.summary: The hook enables you to monitor and record input events. Typically, you use this hook to record a sequence of mouse and keyboard events to play back later by using . The hook is a global hook-it cannot be used as a thread-specific hook.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhJournalPlayback
member.summary: The hook enables an application to insert messages into the system message queue. You can use this hook to play back a series of mouse and keyboard events recorded earlier by using . Regular mouse and keyboard input is disabled as long as a hook is installed. A hook is a global hook-it cannot be used as a thread-specific hook. The hook returns a time-out value. This value tells the system how many milliseconds to wait before processing the current message from the playback hook. This enables the hook to control the timing of the events it plays back.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhKeyboard
member.summary: The hook enables an application to monitor message traffic for WM_KEYDOWN and WM_KEYUP messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the hook to monitor keyboard input posted to a message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhCallWndProc
member.summary: The and hooks enable you to monitor messages sent to window procedures. The system calls a hook procedure before passing the message to the receiving window procedure, and calls the hook procedure after the window procedure has processed the message. The hook passes a pointer to a CWPRETSTRUCT structure to the hook procedure. The structure contains the return value from the window procedure that processed the message, as well as the message parameters associated with the message. Subclassing the window does not work for messages set between processes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.MsgFScrollbar
member.summary: The input event occurred in a scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhGetMessage
member.summary: The hook enables an application to monitor messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the hook to monitor mouse and keyboard input and other messages posted to the message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhCbt
member.summary: The system calls a hook procedure before activating, creating, destroying, minimizing, maximizing, moving, or sizing a window; before completing a system command; before removing a mouse or keyboard event from the system message queue; before setting the input focus; or before synchronizing with the system message queue. The value the hook procedure returns determines whether the system allows or prevents one of these operations. The hook is intended primarily for computer-based training (CBT) applications.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhSysMsgFilter
member.summary: The and hooks enable you to monitor messages about to be processed by a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box, and to detect when a different window is about to be activated as a result of the user's pressing the ALT+TAB or ALT+ESC key combination. The hook can only monitor messages passed to a menu, scroll bar, message box, or dialog box created by the application that installed the hook procedure. The hook monitors such messages for all applications. The and hooks enable you to perform message filtering during modal loops that is equivalent to the filtering done in the main message loop. For example, an application often examines a new message in the main loop between the time it retrieves the message from the queue and the time it dispatches the message, performing special processing as appropriate. However, during a modal loop, the system retrieves and dispatches messages without allowing an application the chance to filter the messages in its main message loop. If an application installs a or hook procedure, the system calls the procedure during the modal loop.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhMouse
member.summary: The hook enables you to monitor mouse messages about to be returned by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function. You can use the hook to monitor mouse input posted to a message queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhHardware
member.summary: The hook enables you to monitor various hardware events.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhDebug
member.summary: The system calls a hook procedure before calling hook procedures associated with any other hook in the system. You can use this hook to determine whether to allow the system to call hook procedures associated with other types of hooks.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhShell
member.summary: A shell application can use the hook to receive important notifications. The system calls a hook procedure when the shell application is about to be activated and when a top-level window is created or destroyed. Note that custom shell applications do not receive messages. Therefore, any application that registers itself as the default shell must call the SystemParametersInfo function before it (or any other application) can receive WH_SHELL messages. This function must be called with SPI_SETMINIMIZEDMETRICS and a MINIMIZEDMETRICS structure. Set the iArrange member of this structure to ARW_HIDE.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhForegroundIdle
member.summary: The hook enables you to perform low priority tasks during times when its foreground thread is idle. The system calls a hook procedure when the application's foreground thread is about to become idle.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhCallWndProcRet
member.summary: The and hooks enable you to monitor messages sent to window procedures. The system calls a hook procedure before passing the message to the receiving window procedure, and calls the hook procedure after the window procedure has processed the message. The hook passes a pointer to a CWPRETSTRUCT structure to the hook procedure. The structure contains the return value from the window procedure that processed the message, as well as the message parameters associated with the message. Subclassing the window does not work for messages set between processes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhKeyboardLl
member.summary: The hook enables you to monitor keyboard input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.Win32HookFlags.WhMouseLl
member.summary: The hook enables you to monitor mouse input events about to be posted in a thread input queue.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated attribute values of windows statements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlUserData
member.summary: Sets the user data associated with the window. This data is intended for use by the application that created the window. Its value is initially zero.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlStyle
member.summary: Sets a new window style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlId
member.summary: Sets a new identifier of the child window. The window cannot be a top-level window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlHandleInstance
member.summary: Sets a new application instance handle.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlWndProc
member.summary: Sets a new address for the window procedure. You cannot change this attribute if the window does not belong to the same process as the calling thread.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.GwlExStyle
member.summary: Sets a new extended window style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.DwlMsgResult
member.summary: Retrieves the return value of a message processed in the dialog box procedure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.DwlDlgProc
member.summary: Retrieves the address of the dialog box procedure, or a handle representing the address of the dialog box procedure. You must use the CallWindowProc function to call the dialog box procedure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowLongFlags.DwlUser
member.summary: Retrieves extra information private to the application, such as handles or pointers.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of system command requests.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScfIsSecure
member.summary: Indicates whether the screen saver is secure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.WmSettingChange
member.summary: A message that is sent to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.WmCopyData
member.summary: If the receiving application processes this message, it should return ; otherwise, it should return . The data being passed must not contain pointers or other references to objects not accessible to the application receiving the data. While this message is being sent, the referenced data must not be changed by another thread of the sending process. The receiving application should consider the data read-only. The lParam parameter is valid only during the processing of the message. The receiving application should not free the memory referenced by lParam. If the receiving application must access the data after SendMessage returns, it must copy the data into a local buffer.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.WmInitDialog
member.summary: The dialog box procedure should return to direct the system to set the keyboard focus to the control specified by wParam. Otherwise, it should return to prevent the system from setting the default keyboard focus.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.WmSysCommand
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.WmMouseMove
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScSize
member.summary: Sizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScMove
member.summary: Moves the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScMaximize
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScNextWindow
member.summary: Moves to the next window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScPrevWindow
member.summary: Moves to the previous window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScClose
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScVScroll
member.summary: Scrolls vertically.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScHScroll
member.summary: Scrolls horizontally.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScMouseMenu
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a mouse click.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScKeyMenu
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScRestore
member.summary: Restores the window to its normal position and size.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScTaskList
member.summary: Activates the Start menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScScreenSave
member.summary: Executes the screen saver application specified in the [boot] section of the System.ini file.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScHotkey
member.summary: Activates the window associated with the application-specified hot key. The lParam parameter identifies the window to activate.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScDefault
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScMonitorPower
member.summary: Sets the state of the display. This command supports devices that have power-saving features, such as a battery-powered personal computer. - The lParam parameter can have the following values: -1 (the display is powering on), 1 (the display is going to low power), 2 (the display is being shut off).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowMenuFlags.ScContextHelp
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacementFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated flags of window placements.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacementFlags.AsyncWindowPlacement
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacementFlags.RestoreToMaximized
member.summary:
The restored window will be maximized, regardless of whether it was maximized before it was minimized. This setting is only valid the next time the window is restored. It does not change the default restoration behavior.
This flag is only valid when the value is specified for the showCmd member.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowPlacementFlags.SetMinimizedPosition
member.summary:
The coordinates of the minimized window may be specified.
This flag must be specified if the coordinates are set in the ptMinPosition member.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Border
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Caption
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the style).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Child
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ChildWindow
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ClipChildren
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ClipSiblings
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Disabled
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.DlgFrame
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Group
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.HorScroll
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Iconic
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Maximize
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.MaximizeBox
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the style. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Minimize
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.MinimizeBox
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the style. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Overlapped
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.OverlappedWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Popup
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.PopupWindow
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The and styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.SizeBox
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.SysMenu
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The style must also be specified.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.TabStop
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ThickFrame
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Tiled
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.TiledWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.Visible
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.VerScroll
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExAcceptFiles
member.summary: The window accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExAppWindow
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExClientEdge
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExComposited
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExContextHelp
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. cannot be used with the or styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExControlParent
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExDlgModalFrame
member.summary: The window has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExLayered
member.summary: The window is a layered window. This style cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExLayoutRightToLeft
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExLeft
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExLeftScrollbar
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExLeftToRightReading
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExMdiChild
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExNoActivate
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExNoInheritLayout
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExNoParentNotify
member.summary: The child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExNoRedirectionBitmap
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExOverlappedWindow
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExPaletteWindow
member.summary: The window is palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExRight
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExRightScrollbar
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExRightToLeftReading
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExStaticEdge
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExToolWindow
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExTopMost
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExTransparent
member.summary: The window should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowStyleFlags.ExWindowEdge
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of window theme attributes.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags.NoDrawCaption
member.summary: Prevents the window caption from being drawn.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags.NoDrawIcon
member.summary: Prevents the system icon from being drawn.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags.NoSysMenu
member.summary: Prevents the system icon menu from appearing.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags.NoMirrorHelp
member.summary: Prevents mirroring of the question mark, even in right-to-left (RTL) layout.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.WindowThemeAttributeFlags.ValidBits
member.summary: A mask that contains all the valid bits.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of token access rights.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.StandardRightsRequired
member.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL), the right to delete the object, the right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the object's security descriptor, the right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor, and the right to use the object for synchronization.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.StandardRightsRead
member.summary: The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor, not including the information in the system access control list (SACL).

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAssignPrimary
member.summary: Required to attach a primary token to a process. The SE_ASSIGNPRIMARYTOKEN_NAME privilege is also required to accomplish this task.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenDuplicate
member.summary: Required to duplicate an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenImpersonate
member.summary: Required to attach an impersonation access token to a process.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenQuery
member.summary: Required to query an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenQuerySource
member.summary: Required to query the source of an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAdjustPrivileges
member.summary: Required to enable or disable the privileges in an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAdjustGroups
member.summary: Required to adjust the attributes of the groups in an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAdjustDefault
member.summary: Required to change the default owner, primary group, or DACL of an access token.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAdjustSessionid
member.summary: Required to adjust the session ID of an access token. The SE_TCB_NAME privilege is required.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenRead
member.summary: Combines and .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.AccessTokenFlags.TokenAllAccess
member.summary: Combines all possible access rights for a token.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values that control how the process is created.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateDefaultErrorMode
member.summary: The new process does not inherit the error mode of the calling process. Instead, the new process gets the current default error mode.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateNewConsole
member.summary: The new process has a new console, instead of inheriting the parent's console.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateNewProcessGroup
member.summary: The new process is the root process of a new process group. The process group includes all processes that are descendants of this root process. The process identifier of the new process group is the same as the process identifier, which is returned in the lpProcessInfo parameter.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateSeparateWowVdm
member.summary: This flag is only valid starting a 16-bit Windows-based application. If set, the new process runs in a private Virtual DOS Machine (VDM). By default, all 16-bit Windows-based applications run in a single, shared VDM. The advantage of running separately is that a crash only terminates the single VDM; any other programs running in distinct VDMs continue to function normally. Also, 16-bit Windows-based applications that run in separate VDMs have separate input queues. That means that if one application stops responding momentarily, applications in separate VDMs continue to receive input.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateSuspended
member.summary: The primary thread of the new process is created in a suspended state.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.CreateUnicodeEnvironment
member.summary: Indicates the format of the lpEnvironment parameter. If this flag is set, the environment block pointed to by lpEnvironment uses Unicode characters. Otherwise, the environment block uses ANSI characters.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.CreationFlags.ExtendedStartupInfoPresent
member.summary: The process is created with extended startup information.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values that specify file informations.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.AddOverlays
member.summary: Apply the appropriate overlays to the file's icon. The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.AttrSpecified
member.summary: Modify to indicate that the dwAttributes member of the SHFILEINFO structure at psfi contains the specific attributes that are desired. These attributes are passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf. If this flag is not specified, 0xFFFFFFFF is passed to IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf, requesting all attributes. This flag cannot be specified with the flag.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.Attributes
member.summary: Retrieve the item attributes. The attributes are copied to the dwAttributes member of the structure specified in the psfi parameter. These are the same attributes that are obtained from IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.DisplayName
member.summary: Retrieve the display name for the file, which is the name as it appears in Windows Explorer. The name is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified in psfi. The returned display name uses the long file name, if there is one, rather than the 8.3 form of the file name. Note that the display name can be affected by settings such as whether extensions are shown.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.ExeType
member.summary: Retrieve the type of the executable file if pszPath identifies an executable file. The information is packed into the return value. This flag cannot be specified with any other flags.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.Icon
member.summary: Retrieve the handle to the icon that represents the file and the index of the icon within the system image list. The handle is copied to the hIcon member of the structure specified by psfi, and the index is copied to the iIcon member.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.IconLocation
member.summary: Retrieve the name of the file that contains the icon representing the file specified by pszPath, as returned by the IExtractIcon::GetIconLocation method of the file's icon handler. Also retrieve the icon index within that file. The name of the file containing the icon is copied to the szDisplayName member of the structure specified by psfi. The icon's index is copied to that structure's iIcon member.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.LargeIcon
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to retrieve the file's large icon. The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.LinkOverlay
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to add the link overlay to the file's icon. The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.OpenIcon
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to retrieve the file's open icon. Also used to modify , causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains the file's small open icon. A container object displays an open icon to indicate that the container is open. The and/or flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.OverlayIndex
member.summary: Return the index of the overlay icon. The value of the overlay index is returned in the upper eight bits of the iIcon member of the structure specified by psfi. This flag requires that the be set as well.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.PidL
member.summary: Indicate that pszPath is the address of an ITEMIDLIST structure rather than a path name.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.Selected
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to blend the file's icon with the system highlight color. The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.ShellIconSize
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to retrieve a Shell-sized icon. If this flag is not specified the function sizes the icon according to the system metric values. The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.SmallIcon
member.summary: Modify , causing the function to retrieve the file's small icon. Also used to modify , causing the function to return the handle to the system image list that contains small icon images. The and/or flag must also be set.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.SysIconIndex
member.summary: Retrieve the index of a system image list icon. If successful, the index is copied to the iIcon member of psfi. The return value is a handle to the system image list. Only those images whose indices are successfully copied to iIcon are valid. Attempting to access other images in the system image list will result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.TypeName
member.summary: Retrieve the string that describes the file's type. The string is copied to the szTypeName member of the structure specified in psfi.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.FileInfoFlags.UseFileAttributes
member.summary: Indicates that the function should not attempt to access the file specified by pszPath. Rather, it should act as if the file specified by pszPath exists with the file attributes passed in dwFileAttributes. This flag cannot be combined with the , , or flags.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.LogonOptions
member.summary: Provides enumerated logon options.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.LogonOptions.WithProfile
member.summary: Log on, then load the user's profile in the HKEY_USERS registry key. The function returns after the profile has been loaded. Loading the profile can be time-consuming, so it is best to use this value only if you must access the information in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.LogonOptions.NetCredentialsOnly
member.summary:
Log on, but use the specified credentials on the network only. The new process uses the same token as the caller, but the system creates a new logon session within LSA, and the process uses the specified credentials as the default credentials.
This value can be used to create a process that uses a different set of credentials locally than it does remotely. This is useful in inter-domain scenarios where there is no trust relationship.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes
member.summary: Specifies the type of application that is described by the structure.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.UnknownApp
member.summary: The application cannot be classified as any other type. An application of this type can only be shut down by a forced shutdown.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.MainWindow
member.summary: A Windows application run as a stand-alone process that displays a top-level window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.OtherWindow
member.summary: A Windows application that does not run as a stand-alone process and does not display a top-level window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.Service
member.summary: The application is a Windows service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.Explorer
member.summary: The application is Windows Explorer.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.Console
member.summary: The application is a stand-alone console application.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.RmAppTypes.Critical
member.summary: A system restart is required to complete the installation because a process cannot be shut down. The process cannot be shut down because of the following reasons. The process may be a critical process. The current user may not have permission to shut down the process. The process may belong to the primary installer that started the Restart Manager.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of service access rights.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.AllAccess
member.summary: Includes in addition to all access rights in this table.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.ChangeConfig
member.summary: Required to call the ChangeServiceConfig or ChangeServiceConfig2 function to change the service configuration. Because this grants the caller the right to change the executable file that the system runs, it should be granted only to administrators.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.EnumerateDependents
member.summary: Required to call the EnumDependentServices function to enumerate all the services dependent on the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.Interrogate
member.summary: Required to call the ControlService function to ask the service to report its status immediately.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.PauseContinue
member.summary: Required to call the ControlService function to pause or continue the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.QueryConfig
member.summary: Required to call the QueryServiceConfig and QueryServiceConfig2 functions to query the service configuration.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.QueryStatus
member.summary:
Required to call the QueryServiceStatus or QueryServiceStatusEx function to ask the service control manager about the status of the service.
Required to call the NotifyServiceStatusChange function to receive notification when a service changes status.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.StandardRequired
member.summary: The standard rights.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.Start
member.summary: Required to call the StartService function to start the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.Stop
member.summary: Required to call the ControlService function to stop the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceAccessRights.UserDefinedControl
member.summary: Required to call the ControlService function to specify a user-defined control code.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the service start options.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags.AutoStart
member.summary: A service started automatically by the service control manager during system startup. For more information, see Automatically Starting Services.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags.BootStart
member.summary: A device driver started by the system loader. This value is valid only for driver services.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags.DemandStart
member.summary: A service started by the service control manager when a process calls the StartService function. For more information, see Starting Services on Demand.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags.Disabled
member.summary: A service that cannot be started. Attempts to start the service result in the error code.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceBootFlags.SystemStart
member.summary: A device driver started by the IoInitSystem function. This value is valid only for driver services.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the service control options.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.Continue
member.summary: Notifies a paused service that it should resume. The hService handle must have the access right.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.Interrogate
member.summary:
Notifies a service that it should report its current status information to the service control manager. The hService handle must have the access right.
Note that this control is not generally useful as the SCM is aware of the current state of the service.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.NetBindAdd
member.summary: Notifies a network service that there is a new component for binding. The hService handle must have the access right. However, this control code has been deprecated; use Plug and Play functionality instead.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.NetBindDisable
member.summary: Notifies a network service that one of its bindings has been disabled. The hService handle must have the access right. However, this control code has been deprecated; use Plug and Play functionality instead.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.NetBindEnable
member.summary: Notifies a network service that a disabled binding has been enabled. The hService handle must have the access right. However, this control code has been deprecated; use Plug and Play functionality instead.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.NetBindRemove
member.summary: Notifies a network service that a component for binding has been removed. The hService handle must have the access right. However, this control code has been deprecated; use Plug and Play functionality instead.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.ParamChange
member.summary: Notifies a service that its startup parameters have changed. The hService handle must have the access right.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.Pause
member.summary: Notifies a service that it should pause. The hService handle must have the access right.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlOptions.Stop
member.summary:
Notifies a service that it should stop. The hService handle must have the access right.
After sending the stop request to a service, you should not send other controls to the service.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlTypes
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of the service control types.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlTypes.AcceptNetBindChange
member.summary: The service is a network component that can accept changes in its binding without being stopped and restarted.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlTypes.AcceptParamChange
member.summary: The service can reread its startup parameters without being stopped and restarted.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlTypes.AcceptPauseContinue
member.summary: The service can be paused and continued.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceControlTypes.AcceptStop
member.summary: The service can be stopped.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of service control manager access rights.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.AllAccess
member.summary: Includes , in addition to all access rights in this table.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.CreateService
member.summary: Required to call the CreateService function to create a service object and add it to the database.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.Connect
member.summary: Required to connect to the service control manager.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.EnumerateService
member.summary:
Required to call the EnumServicesStatus or EnumServicesStatusEx function to list the services that are in the database.
Required to call the NotifyServiceStatusChange function to receive notification when any service is created or deleted.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.Lock
member.summary: Required to call the LockServiceDatabase function to acquire a lock on the database.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.ModifyBootConfig
member.summary: Required to call the NotifyBootConfigStatus function.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.ServiceManagerAccessRights.QueryLockStatus
member.summary: Required to call the QueryServiceLockStatus function to retrieve the lock status information for the database.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.SecurityImpersonationLevels
member.summary: Provides enumerated values that specify security impersonation levels.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SecurityImpersonationLevels.SecurityAnonymous
member.summary: The server process cannot obtain identification information about the client, and it cannot impersonate the client. It is defined with no value given, and thus, by ANSI C rules, defaults to a value of zero.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SecurityImpersonationLevels.SecurityIdentification
member.summary: The server process can obtain information about the client, such as security identifiers and privileges, but it cannot impersonate the client. This is useful for servers that export their own objects, for example, database products that export tables and views. Using the retrieved client-security information, the server can make access-validation decisions without being able to use other services that are using the client's security context.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SecurityImpersonationLevels.SecurityImpersonation
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context on its local system. The server cannot impersonate the client on remote systems.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.SecurityImpersonationLevels.SecurityDelegation
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context on remote systems.

member.name: T:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags
member.summary: Provides enumerated values of process start flags.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.ForceOnFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the cursor is in feedback mode for two seconds after CreateProcess is called. The Working in Background cursor is displayed (see the Pointers tab in the Mouse control panel utility).
If during those two seconds the process makes the first GUI call, the system gives five more seconds to the process. If during those five seconds the process shows a window, the system gives five more seconds to the process to finish drawing the window.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.ForceOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the feedback cursor is forced off while the process is starting. The Normal Select cursor is displayed.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.PreventPinning
member.summary:
Indicates that any windows created by the process cannot be pinned on the taskbar.
This flag must be combined with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.RunFullscreen
member.summary:
Indicates that the process should be run in full-screen mode, rather than in windowed mode.
This flag is only valid for console applications running on an x86 computer.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.TitleIsAppId
member.summary:
The lpTitle member contains an AppUserModelID. This identifier controls how the taskbar and Start menu present the application, and enables it to be associated with the correct shortcuts and Jump Lists.
If is used, application windows cannot be pinned on the taskbar. The use of any AppUserModelID-related window properties by the application overrides this setting for that window only.
This flag cannot be used with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.TitleIsLinkName
member.summary:
The lpTitle member contains the path of the shortcut file (.lnk) that the user invoked to start this process. This is typically set by the shell when a .lnk file pointing to the launched application is invoked. Most applications will not need to set this value.
This flag cannot be used with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UntrustedSource
member.summary: The command line came from an untrusted source.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UseCountChars
member.summary: The dwXCountChars and dwYCountChars members contain additional information.

member.summary: The dwXCountChars and dwYCountChars members contain additional information.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UseHotkey
member.summary:
The hStdInput member contains additional information.
This flag cannot be used with .

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UsePosition
member.summary: The dwX and dwY members contain additional information.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UseShowWindow
member.summary: The wShowWindow member contains additional information.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UseSize
member.summary: The dwXSize and dwYSize members contain additional information.

member.name: F:SilDev.WinApi.StartFlags.UseStdHandles
member.summary:
The hStdInput, hStdOutput, and hStdError members contain additional information.
If this flag is specified when calling one of the process creation functions, the handles must be inheritable and the function's bInheritHandles parameter must be set to .
Handles must be closed with when they are no longer needed.
This flag cannot be used with .
